item.title: How to Get a Pokemon With Ice Beam in Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Reaching Rank D)
item.description:
For Main Mission 19 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , you will eventually need to help Ivor find his little sister, Gywnn, with the help of Detective Emma. The trio will realize that Gwynn might be in the sewers, so you need to use the Ice-type move, Ice Beam, to freeze the Clawitzer fountain and make the water stop.

This guide will show Pokemon Legends: Z-A trainers how to easily find Ice Beam to get the mission over with.

How to Get a Pokemon With Ice Beam Fast in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Freeze the Clawitzer Fountain

To find a Pokemon with Ice Beam fast, you can head over to the nearby Wild Zone 12. The zone has a bunch of different Ice-type Pokemon to catch, like Vanillite , Snover , and Abomasnow --all Pokemon that can be taught Ice Beam.

As far as how to get the Ice Beam TM to teach to a Pokemon, it's actually right in the court (Aymlis Park) on the northern end of Wild Zone 12 . You'll need to break some boulders before gaining access, and then you'll see a glowing yellow Poke Ball in the middle of the court. This is the Ice Beam TM.

Ice Beam does 90 damage and may leave the target frozen. It has a cooldown of eight seconds.

You can go to your TMs section of the Items bag to find Ice Beam and then teach it to a Pokemon on your team, or just go into your Boxes, choose an Ice-type Pokemon, go to its moves, and then tab over to Available TMs with ZR. If Ice Beam shows up, the Pokemon can learn it.

If you end up catching Vanillite , there's a chance it might actually already know Ice Beam, so it saves you the trouble of finding and using the TM in Wild Zone 12.

Head back to the fountain statue and add the Pokemon to your team. Target the statue with ZL and then use Ice Beam to freeze it , starting the next objective for the mission.

32
4.6 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Vampire Survivors - Version 1.14 Westwoods Update Announcement Trailer
item.description: Vampire Survivors gives an in-your-face look at its gambling heavy Version 1.14 Westwood Update, which should have a big impact on the game. The Westwoods Update is expected to hit Vampire Survivors in Autumn 2025.

item.title: Once Upon a Katamari - Diver Song Trailer
item.description: Once Upon a Katamari shows The Prince in all new object-rolling adventures laid over the catchy Diver sung by Yakushimaru Etsuko. Once Upon a Katamari launches on October 25, 2025 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch, and PC.

item.title: Square Enix Video Compares Final Fantasy 7 Remake Switch 2 Performance to Other Platforms
item.description:
A new video released by Square Enix is showing off a comparison between the gameplay for Final Fantasy 7 Remake on Switch 2 and other platforms. The beloved RPG served as one of the biggest third-party games announced to be receiving a port to the newest Nintendo platform, adding some new features like "Streamlined Mode" for players more focused on the story. Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's Switch 2 version will even include some exclusive perks for pre-orders, with digital pre-orders getting the original Final Fantasy 7 for a limited time. Now, Square Enix is showing off the Switch 2 version's performance.

The Switch 2's performance has served as one of the biggest questions for many big-name ports from other consoles early on. The highly-anticipated Switch 2 port of Elden Ring was reportedly experiencing some severe issues with its early versions, dropping as low as 15 FPS in demos featured at this year's Gamescom. Square Enix has already spoken previously about Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's performance on Switch 2, confirming that the game will run at 30 FPS on the Nintendo platform. A new video is now giving a visual showcase of the remake's Switch 2 performance.

A new video uploaded to Square Enix's official YouTube channel compares the performance of Final Fantasy 7 Remake on Switch 2 to other platforms. The showcase features a side-by-side view of the Switch 2 version in TV Mode, the PS5, Xbox Series X, and PC versions of the game, featuring much of the same visual fidelity and detail. Director Naoki Hamaguchi previously revealed that the Switch 2 version features light rendering similar to the PS5 version, with a focus on using lighting to make the game feel more expressive. The Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy 7 Remake will launch on January 22.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Video Compares Switch 2 Port to Other Platforms

The impressive video showcases few visual compromises with the overall appearance of Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's Switch 2 version. The only majorly noticeable difference between the versions comes with some floor textures during Cloud's introduction, with the ground looking slightly lower-quality on the Switch 2 version. The video also notably runs at 30 FPS for the showcase, not fully revealing the difference between the Switch 2's 30 FPS and other platforms' 60 FPS performance.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's Switch 2 debut in January was not the only game in the trilogy confirmed to be hitting the Nintendo platform. Square Enix confirmed last month that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will also launch on Switch 2 sometime during 2026, though an official release date was not confirmed. The in-development third entry in the trilogy was also confirmed to be releasing for Switch 2, with the final Final Fantasy 7 Remake game still awaiting an official reveal. Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's Switch 2 port will bring the critically-acclaimed RPG to even more fans soon.

9.3 /10
9 /10

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade

item.title: How to Sell & Recycle Items in ARC Raiders
item.description:
Players can find several items during their expeditions in ARC Raiders that can be broken down and recycled into crafting components or sold for coins that are used to purchase items from traders. Players will need to first figure out which items should be sold or recycled. So, this guide will cover everything from how to recycle and sell items to which items you should prioritize selling/recycling first.

How to Sell and Recycle Items in ARC Raiders

During expeditions, players will salvage various crafting components inside buildings, in abandoned structures, and from downed ARC robots. Players can additionally break down some recyclable items to get essential crafting components. Even if they aren't recyclable, these can also be sold from the inventory menu to get some coins.

This adds immense value to a player's time when they're scouring the desolate lands, allowing them to benefit from all and any items found in one way (recycling) or the other (selling). To recycle or sell items in ARC Raiders , you'll first need to open up your inventory. So, scroll to any tab and press one of the following prompts to access the inventory .

  • To access your inventory, press the "TAB" key in the Workshop menu on a keyboard.
  • The "Select or Back" button on an Xbox Controller
  • The "Touchpad Click" on PlayStation controllers.

Now, select an item either from your stash or your character's inventory . After selecting the item, press "Mouse Right-Click" on the mouse or the "Y/Triangle" button on the Xbox and PlayStation controllers to open up the action menu, respectively. From here, you can either sell an item for coins or simply recycle them to get crafting components.

The same can be done on the loadout screen right before starting a match in ARC Raiders .

Which Items to Sell or Recycle First in ARC Raiders

Players will be securing a ton of items upon successfully extracting from matches, which can quickly fill up your stash space in ARC Raiders . To avoid needing to spend coins on expanding your stash space early on, you'll need to clear up inventory by either recycling items or selling them in the game.

Almost all items in ARC Raiders can either be sold or recycled, which makes it tough to identify which ones to prioritize first. However, there's a way for players to know which items are meant to be dealt with in one way or the other. Here's how.

  • For items that should be recycled in ARC Raiders , you'll see a "Recyclable" tag when you hover your cursor over them. Their descriptions will also only say: "This item can be recycled into XYZ (crafting component name)."
  • For items that should be sold in ARC Raiders , you'll see a diamond symbol in their thumbnail image, and they should have a "Trinket" tag associated with them. Selling these will give you the most amount of coins, allowing you to purchase items from traders.

Some items may still have "can be recycled for components" in their descriptions, but will often say that they can be used in crafting a specific gear, utility, or weapon. It's best to carefully sift through your inventory before pressing the trigger on either selling or recycling to ensure you don't get rid of valuable crafting components by accident.
